documentation:
---
#https://www.notion.so/n8n/Frontmatter-432c2b8dff1f43d4b1c8d20075510fe4
title: Harvest node documentation
description: Learn how to use the Harvest node in n8n. Follow technical documentation to integrate Harvest node into your workflows.
contentType: [integration, reference]
---

# Harvest node

Use the Harvest node to automate work in Harvest, and integrate Harvest with other applications. n8n has built-in support for a wide range of Harvest features, including creating, updating, deleting, and getting clients, contacts, invoices, tasks, expenses, users, and projects. 

On this page, you'll find a list of operations the Harvest node supports and links to more resources.

/// note | Credentials
Refer to [Harvest credentials](/integrations/builtin/credentials/harvest.md) for guidance on setting up authentication. 
///

## Operations

* Client
    * Create a client
    * Delete a client
    * Get data of a client
    * Get data of all clients
    * Update a client
* Company
    * Retrieves the company for the currently authenticated user
* Contact
    * Create a contact
    * Delete a contact
    * Get data of a contact
    * Get data of all contacts
    * Update a contact
* Estimate
    * Create an estimate
    * Delete an estimate
    * Get data of an estimate
    * Get data of all estimates
    * Update an estimate
* Expense
    * Get data of an expense
    * Get data of all expenses
    * Create an expense
    * Update an expense
    * Delete an expense
* Invoice
    * Get data of an invoice
    * Get data of all invoices
    * Create an invoice
    * Update an invoice
    * Delete an invoice
* Project
    * Create a project
    * Delete a project
    * Get data of a project
    * Get data of all projects
    * Update a project
* Task
    * Create a task
    * Delete a task
    * Get data of a task
    * Get data of all tasks
    * Update a task
* Time Entries
    * Create a time entry using duration
    * Create a time entry using start and end time
    * Delete a time entry
    * Delete a time entry's external reference.
    * Get data of a time entry
    * Get data of all time entries
    * Restart a time entry
    * Stop a time entry
    * Update a time entry
* User
    * Create a user
    * Delete a user
    * Get data of a user
    * Get data of all users
    * Get data of authenticated user
    * Update a user

## Templates and examples

options.name: client_id
options.description: Only return time entries belonging to the client with the given ID

options.name: from
options.description: Only return time entries with a spent_date on or after the given date

options.name: state
options.description: Only return estimates with a state matching the value provided. Options: draft, sent, accepted, or declined.

options.name: to
options.description: Only return time entries with a spent_date on or before the given date

options.name: updated_since
options.description: Only return time entries that have been updated since the given date and time

options.name: page
options.description: The page number to use in pagination. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 records, your subsequent call can include page=2 to retrieve the next page of the list. (Default: 1)

options.name: currency
options.description: The currency used by the estimate. If not provided, the client’s currency will be used. See a list of supported currencies

options.name: over_budget_notification_percentage
options.description: This percentage is subtracted from the subtotal. Example: use 10.0 for 10.0%.

options.name: issue_date
options.description: Date the invoice was issued. Defaults to today’s date.

options.name: notes
options.description: Any additional notes to include on the estimate

options.name: number
options.description: If no value is set, the number will be automatically generated

options.name: purchase_order
options.description: The purchase order number

options.name: subject
options.description: The estimate subject

options.name: tax
options.description: This percentage is applied to the subtotal, including line items and discounts. Example: use 10.0 for 10.0%.

properties_schema.name: id
properties_schema.description: The ID of the project want to delete

properties_schema.name: name
properties_schema.description: The name of the project

properties_schema.name: clientId
properties_schema.description: The ID of the client to associate this project with

properties_schema.name: isBillable
properties_schema.description: Whether the project is billable or not

properties_schema.name: billBy
properties_schema.description: The method by which the project is invoiced

properties_schema.name: budgetBy
properties_schema.description: The email of the user or "none"

options.name: budget
options.description: The budget in hours for the project when budgeting by time

options.name: budget_is_monthly
options.description: Whether the budget resets every month. Defaults to false.

options.name: cost_budget
options.description: The monetary budget for the project when budgeting by money

options.name: cost_budget_include_expenses
options.description: Option for budget of Total Project Fees projects to include tracked expenses. Defaults to false.

options.name: ends_on
options.description: Date the project will end

options.name: fee
options.description: The amount you plan to invoice for the project. Only used by fixed-fee projects.

options.name: hourly_rate
options.description: Rate for projects billed by Project Hourly Rate

options.name: is_active
options.description: Whether the project is active or archived. Defaults to true.

options.name: is_fixed_fee
options.description: Whether the project is a fixed-fee project or not

options.name: notes
options.description: Notes about the project

options.name: notify_when_over_budget
options.description: Whether project managers should be notified when the project goes over budget. Defaults to false.

options.name: over_budget_notification_percentage
options.description: Percentage value used to trigger over budget email alerts. Example: use 10.0 for 10.0%.

options.name: show_budget_to_all
options.description: Whether to show project budget to all employees. Does not apply to Total Project Fee projects. Defaults to false.

options.name: starts_on
options.description: Date the project was started

properties_schema.description: The ID of the project to associate with the time entry

properties_schema.name: taskId
properties_schema.description: The ID of the task to associate with the time entry

properties_schema.name: spentDate
properties_schema.description: The ISO 8601 formatted date the time entry was spent

options.name: hours
options.description: The current amount of time tracked

options.name: notes
options.description: These are notes about the time entry

options.name: user_id
options.description: The ID of the user to associate with the time entry. Defaults to the currently authenticated user’s ID.

properties_schema.name: projectId
properties_schema.description: The ID of the project to associate with the time entry

properties_schema.name: taskId
properties_schema.description: The ID of the task to associate with the time entry

properties_schema.name: spentDate
properties_schema.description: The ISO 8601 formatted date the time entry was spent

options.name: ended_time
options.description: The time the entry ended

options.name: notes
options.description: These are notes about the time entry

options.name: started_time
options.description: The time the entry started. Defaults to the current time. Example: “8:00am”.

options.name: user_id
options.description: The ID of the user to associate with the time entry. Defaults to the currently authenticated user’s ID.

properties_schema.name: returnAll
properties_schema.description: Whether to return all results or only up to a given limit

properties_schema.name: limit
properties_schema.description: Max number of results to return

options.name: is_active
options.description: Whether to only return active users and false to return inactive users

options.name: updated_since
options.description: Only return users belonging to the user with the given ID

options.name: page
options.description: The page number to use in pagination

properties_schema.name: id
properties_schema.description: The ID of the user you are retrieving

properties_schema.name: id
properties_schema.description: The ID of the user you want to delete

properties_schema.name: firstName
properties_schema.description: The first name of the user

properties_schema.name: lastName
properties_schema.description: The last name of the user

properties_schema.name: email
properties_schema.description: The email of the user

options.name: can_create_invoices
options.description: Whether the user can create invoices. Only applicable to Project Managers.

options.name: can_create_projects
options.description: Whether the user can create projects. Only applicable to Project Managers.

options.name: can_see_rates
options.description: Whether the user can see billable rates on projects. Only applicable to Project Managers.

options.name: cost_rate
options.description: The cost rate to use for this user when calculating a project’s costs vs billable amount

options.name: default_hourly_rate
options.description: The billable rate to use for this user when they are added to a project

options.displayName: Has Access To All Future Projects
options.name: has_access_to_all_future_projects
options.description: Whether the user should be automatically added to future projects

options.name: is_active
options.description: Whether the user is active or archived

options.name: is_admin
options.description: Whether the user has Admin permissions

options.name: is_contractor
options.description: Whether the user is a contractor or an employee

options.name: is_project_manager
options.description: Whether the user has Project Manager permissions

options.name: roles
options.description: The role names assigned to this person

options.name: timezone
options.description: The user’s timezone. Defaults to the company’s timezone. See a list of supported time zones.

options.name: weekly_capacity
options.description: The number of hours per week this person is available to work in seconds. Defaults to 126000 seconds (35 hours).
